title: None permission staff member can identify installed application and products attached to it

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information:
Hello,
To see if a store has application installed and which products its configured the staff member should have application permission otherwise nothing is visible but i found a way that let none permission staff member to identify if the store has installed Digital Downloads and if the application configured on a particular products.

POC:
1)Create two user A and B, login to A and create a store, test.myshopify.com
2)Add user B as staff member to test.myshopify.com with no permission.
3)From user A, go test.myshopify.com and create two product called Tt and PP
4)Install Digital Downloads for this store and configure Tt to this app.
5)Login back to user B and create an independent store, test100.myshopify.com and install Digital Downloads on this store.
6)Now go to user A store (test.myshopfy.com) and click app and click Digital downlands and right click on the product, you will get below urli
https://delivery.shopifyapps.com/products/3785077260000
7)Copy paste to this url from user B account (login as user B) and you can see that a message as below.
Digital Downloads/Tt
This indicate that Digital Downloads is installed on test.myshopfy.com store (which this user has 0 permission) and configured on the product Tt.
8)If you user the same url with PP product id, nothing is shown

User B can get products ids via source page of user A store as user B is staff member even though none permission 

view-source:https://test.myshopify.com/products/tt

<script id="__st">var __st={"a":2616790000,"offset":-14400,"reqid":"fff-bbb-ccc-bbb-qqq","pageurl":"test-myshopify.com\/products\/tt","u":"184d9400000a","p":"product","rtyp":"product","rid":3785077260000};</script>

## Impact

This is an information disclosure, none permission member staff should not know which application is installed and what product is configured for this application.

Please find the screen shots

To see if a store has application installed and which products its configured the staff member should have application permission otherwise nothing is visible but i found a way that let none permission staff member to identify if the store has installed Digital Downloads and if the application configured on a particular products.

POC:
1)Create two user A and B, login to A and create a store, test.myshopify.com
2)Add user B as staff member to test.myshopify.com with no permission.
3)From user A, go test.myshopify.com and create two product called Tt and PP
4)Install Digital Downloads for this store and configure Tt to this app.
5)Login back to user B and create an independent store, test100.myshopify.com and install Digital Downloads on this store.
6)Now go to user A store (test.myshopfy.com) and click app and click Digital downlands and right click on the product, you will get below urli
https://delivery.shopifyapps.com/products/3785077260000
7)Copy paste to this url from user B account (login as user B) and you can see that a message as below.
Digital Downloads/Tt
This indicate that Digital Downloads is installed on test.myshopfy.com store (which this user has 0 permission) and configured on the product Tt.
8)If you user the same url with PP product id, nothing is shown

User B can get products ids via source page of user A store as user B is staff member even though none permission

activities.message:
Hi @sreeju_kc,

Thank you for the report. The behaviour you have described does not disclose the existence of a product in Digital Downloads or that a store has Digital Downloads installed. Regardless of if an ID does not exist or is associated with another store, you will receive the same error message: `This product has been removed from your admin.`. You can test this by visiting https://delivery.shopifyapps.com/products/9999999999999999999999 (9999999999999999999999 being a product ID that does not exist) and observing that you receive the same error message. For this reason, we will close this report as Not Applicable.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @sreeju_kc,

Thank you for the report. The behaviour you have described does not disclose the existence of a product in Digital Downloads or that a store has Digital Downloads installed. Regardless of if an ID does not exist or is associated with another store, you will receive the same error message: This product has been removed from your admin.. You can test this by visiting https://delivery.shopifyapps.com/products/9999999999999999999999 (9999999999999999999999 being a product ID that does not exist) and observing that you receive the same error message. For this reason, we will close this report as Not Applicable.

activities.message:
Hello @jack_mccracken 

Please have a look at the screenshots i have attached. There is indeed a difference in valid product and non valid product, valid product will have a title "Digital Downloads/Tt" and non valid product wont have the title but it just have title Digital Downloads and an error message as you have described. I have rested several times

activities.message:
Hello,

To show better I have created a video POC, please find it in the attachment. Please note the important points to reproduce.

1)Create two user A and B, login to A and create a store, test.myshopify.com

2)Add user B as staff member to test.myshopify.com with no permission.

3)From user A, go test.myshopify.com and create two product called Tt and PP

4)Install Digital Downloads to this store and add Tt to in Digital Downloads, make sure to ATTACH/UPLOAD an image to the product in Digital downloads then only this product shows in the digital download dashboard

5)Login back to user B and create an independent store, testforB.myshopify.com and install Digital Downloads on this store.# just install is enough no need to add any products.

6)Now go back to user A store (test.myshopfy.com) and click app and click Digital downlands  and go to dashboard and right click on the product  you will get below urli

https://delivery.shopifyapps.com/products/3785077260000

7)Copy paste to this url from user B account (login as user B) and you can see an error message but you can see a titile as "Digital Downloads/Tt"  this title indicate that Tt is added to digital downloads and store has digital downloads enabled.

8)If you use the same url with PP (product is not in Digital Download) product id or an invalid product id, you can still see an error message but the title is different instead of "Digital Downloads/Tt" this time just "Digital Downloads"

I have tested several times and its reproducable, please watch the video POC
activities.markdown_message:
Hello,

To show better I have created a video POC, please find it in the attachment. Please note the important points to reproduce.

1)Create two user A and B, login to A and create a store, test.myshopify.com

2)Add user B as staff member to test.myshopify.com with no permission.

3)From user A, go test.myshopify.com and create two product called Tt and PP

4)Install Digital Downloads to this store and add Tt to in Digital Downloads, make sure to ATTACH/UPLOAD an image to the product in Digital downloads then only this product shows in the digital download dashboard

5)Login back to user B and create an independent store, testforB.myshopify.com and install Digital Downloads on this store.# just install is enough no need to add any products.

6)Now go back to user A store (test.myshopfy.com) and click app and click Digital downlands and go to dashboard and right click on the product you will get below urli

https://delivery.shopifyapps.com/products/3785077260000

7)Copy paste to this url from user B account (login as user B) and you can see an error message but you can see a titile as "Digital Downloads/Tt" this title indicate that Tt is added to digital downloads and store has digital downloads enabled.

8)If you use the same url with PP (product is not in Digital Download) product id or an invalid product id, you can still see an error message but the title is different instead of "Digital Downloads/Tt" this time just "Digital Downloads"

I have tested several times and its reproducable, please watch the video POC

activities.message:
Hi @sreeju_kc,

Sorry for the delay. Thank you for the additional context. It does appear that we are improperly disclosing the title of the product here. For that reason, we'll reopen and triage this report.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @sreeju_kc,

Sorry for the delay. Thank you for the additional context. It does appear that we are improperly disclosing the title of the product here. For that reason, we'll reopen and triage this report.

activities.message: Thanks again for the report. We're awarding a $500 bounty under the "IDOR / Information Disclosure" category for Non-Core apps. We'll be in touch again once the issue is resolved.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks again for the report. We're awarding a $500 bounty under the "IDOR / Information Disclosure" category for Non-Core apps. We'll be in touch again once the issue is resolved.

activities.message:
Hi @sreeju_kc,

We recently deployed a fix for this issue. For this reason, we will be closing this report as Resolved.

Thanks again for the report. We look forward to hearing from you again soon!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @sreeju_kc,

We recently deployed a fix for this issue. For this reason, we will be closing this report as Resolved.

Thanks again for the report. We look forward to hearing from you again soon!

summaries.content:
@sreeju_kc found that the endpoint at https://delivery.shopifyapps.com/products/ID returned the product title of products with attachments that did not belong to the current shop. We resolved this issue by only displaying the product title when the product belongs to the current shop.

As the scope was limited to stores with the Digital Downloads app installed and products with attachments, we awarded our minimum bounty for non-core IDOR/Information Disclosure, $500.
summaries.content_html:
@sreeju_kc found that the endpoint at https://delivery.shopifyapps.com/products/ID returned the product title of products with attachments that did not belong to the current shop. We resolved this issue by only displaying the product title when the product belongs to the current shop.

As the scope was limited to stores with the Digital Downloads app installed and products with attachments, we awarded our minimum bounty for non-core IDOR/Information Disclosure, $500.
